intro: Pouzolzia lythroides, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its roots are often reddish in color, which gives it its common name. Pouzolzia lythroides is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
